summary: The Coast Guard Authorization Act of 2025 addresses various aspects of the U.S. Coast Guard, including appropriations, personnel, organization, and mission. Key provisions authorize funding, set military strength levels and training, and establish a Secretary. The bill also covers topics like acquisition improvements, vessel safety, merchant mariner credentials, and the establishment of a National Advisory Committee on Autonomous Maritime Systems. Topics also include the approval of a new floating dry dock for the Coast Guard Yard, as well as studies and reports on diverse issues.
